intro: Larsenianthus assamensis, commonly known as the Assam larkspur, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to the northeastern region of India, particularly in the states of Assam and Manipur. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
